main event: A civilian reported observing a stationary object changing colors in Cleveland, Ohio on August 15, 1965.
interesting points: The object was initially seen as a bright star, but appeared larger and changed to a reddish-orange color as it descended., The object was observed for 3 minutes and maintained a straight, vertical flight path., The report categorized the conclusion as a satellite observation., No physical evidence or photographs were provided with the sighting., The observer indicated the object was brighter than the brightest star.
